meanings.definition: To make or become liquid again.
meanings.sent1: After freezing, the sun helped reliquefy the ice into water.
meanings.sent2: She used heat to reliquefy the solid chocolate into a smooth liquid.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to reliquefy the frozen coin, but it turned into a puddle of water instead.
meanings.sent4: His warm smile seemed to reliquefy her frozen heart, melting away all her worries.
meanings.sent5: The summer sun was so hot that it could reliquefy anything left out in the open.
